comment.body: What happens when there's a bug fixed for this blog software? Does our cloned blogs also get "automatically" updated? I assume it's our responsibility to check the github commits...
@theta gevent is a dependency for zeronet.py, check your packag-manager or install via pip (also make sure you have msgpack-python). All written on the project's github page
@theta clone: when I move the mouse at the left side of the text, a pencil symbol comes which you can click and then you can edit the complete text fields

> [jamesheald](#comment_1_1EgYg1XAxktqWHWC1aTWQoToF6Mr5QmEWq): What happens in regards to peers? Because if I go offline, doesnt it mean my blog will too?

when someone reads your blog, this person saves a local copy. So, you can go offline and others will get the copy from him
@kirly isn't the cloning from menu "already" automatic ? When you once do the manual way, later on for changes you just have to execute the siteSign and sitePublish command
@timetraveler how did you make this website? did you clone it or edit it yourself from structure?

@jamesheald besides a proxy you can also use a seeder (1). large data: let's keep stuff at 1 place for now, see later (2). (1) http://127.0.0.1:43110/1LtvsjbtQ2tY7SCtCZzC4KhErqEK3bXD4n/ (2) http://127.0.0.1:43110/Talk.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Topic:1_1EgYg1XAxktqWHWC1aTWQoToF6Mr5QmEWq/How+will+we+end+up+handling+big+amounts+of+data

>Please forgive my ignorance. I am sure this was discussed somewhere. How do we update cloned ZeroBlogs?

see @muja's comment [here](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:4:imagine+you+have+a+known+bug+in+your+cloned+ZeroNet+app...)

nice: "Currently working on Diff/Patch protocol command that will greatly reduces ZeroNet bandwidth usage. Eta 1-2wk"

thank you for all the good work!
@alfur I assume it's your site? Can you open that site correctly in your local browser? I am asking because opening that site says: "Not found: index.html"

@alfur ok, what I meant to say was: 
looks to me as if the site creator did something bad? 
that is why if the site creator can view the site locally fine, 
he perhaps didn't siteSign/Publish his current version?

If the site creator left a way to contact him, please do contact him.

See also: [How to make sure your site is always reachable?](/zeroblog.bit/?Post:31:How+to+make+sure+your+site+is+always+reachable+)

Thanks! works: my blog is now also searched with this.
>156 results from 3 sites in 0.08sec

@kasthu what kind of files do you see in the folder where your site is located? 
You can add content to your site via the languages html, coffeescript/javascript! Do you know any of these?

>@zippity The image shows a search field at the ZeroHello page....how does one make this search field appear?

Which ZeroNet version do you have ? 
You need 0.3.7 rev1232 (see "master branch" [here](/ZeroVersions.bit/interpretation.html)) for upgrading. But keep in mind master branch is always unstable, so make a backup always first
